newsitem.title: MEXICO: Pemex details 10-month crude, natgas output.
newsitem.headline: Pemex details 10-month crude, natgas output.

text.p: Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) said on Monday that Mexico's crude oil production rose 9.4 percent in the January-October period compared to the same period last year to 2.85 million barrels per day (bpd).
The state-owned oil and gas monopoly said crude exports reached an average 1.55 bpd in the first 10 months of the year, compared to 1995.
Natural gas output in the same period rose 13.1 percent, Pemex said, to an average 4.194 billion cubic feet per day (cfd).
In the first 10 months of the year, heavy crude output totaled 1.36 million bpd, light crude was 914,000 bpd and extra light crude 577,000 bpd.

Pemex said the Campeche Sound remained the most important source of crude oil, representing 74.6 percent of total extraction, an average 2.128 million bpd. An average 630,000 bpd came from the southern region and 96,000 northern region, Mexico's oil and gas company said.
Of natural gas produced, 3.482 billion cfd was associated gas and 712 million non-associated gas, which was used for domestic petrochemical production and energy needs.

The southern region producted an average 1.992 billion cfd of natural gas, or 47.5 percent of the total production. The marine zone provided 1.565 billion cfd while the northern region supplied the remaining 637 million cfd.
